info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 8:02AM CDT until March 30 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHEASTERN NEWTON AND NORTH CENTRAL POPE COUNTIES... At 802 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles south of Devils Knob, or 11 miles north of Clarksville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Dillen... Walnut... Bertha... Rosetta... Devils Knob... Fort Douglas... Ozone... Crossroad... Haw Creek Falls Campground... Gum Springs in Newton County... Deer... Cowell... Nail... Sand Gap... Lurton... Mineral Springs Recreation Area... Salus... TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
